definition: to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive

sentences.english: She has an account at that store.
He bought the car on credit.
sentences.chinese: 他賒帳買了這部小汽車。

sentences.english: Have another coffee. We have credit here.
sentences.chinese: 再喝一杯咖啡吧，我們在這兒可以賒帳。

sentences.english: A. Yes. Subject to credit approval, of course.
sentences.chinese: 好，當然是在經過賒帳批准後。

sentences.english: The whole island lives on credit.
sentences.chinese: 全島的人都靠賒帳度日。

sentences.english: He can't buy anything more on credit until he settles his old bills up.
sentences.chinese: 除非他把舊帳付清，否則他不能賒帳購買任何東西。

sentences.english: Everyone keeps offering me credit in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，大家總想讓我賒帳。

sentences.english: You can purchase this TV set on credit.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用賒帳的方式購買這臺電視機。

definition: to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to agree to pay compensation/to accept liability
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
